text: Herring is a ghost town in Sac County, in the U.S. state of Iowa. ==History== Herring was originally called Weed, and under the latter name was platted in 1899. The community was renamed Herring in 1901, in honor of a local pioneer settler. A post office was established at Herring in 1900, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1951. ==References== Category:Geography of Sac County, Iowa Category:Ghost towns in Iowa
title: Herring, Iowa
